description: From Urdu تعلّقہ‎ (talluqa), from Arabic تَعَلُّق‎ (taʕalluq).

entries.meaning: A hereditary estate in parts of India; subsequently, an administrative subdivision of a district.
examples: Suvarnapur, Ratnanagari, a few other native states, and seven or eight taluks were under his jurisdiction.
